nodes.text: Nevar Yalnal was a Ranat with brown hair and black eyes. In 0 BBY, Yalnal spent time in Mos Eisley spaceport on the desert planet Tatooine. After the local moisture farmer Luke Skywalker sold his X-34 landspeeder to the speeder vendor Wioslea, Yalnal walked past the landspeeder while wearing a brown robe.

Nevar Yalnal first appeared in the 1977 original trilogy film, Star Wars: Episode IV A New Hope. The character's mask was made by creature designer Stuart Freeborn and consisted mostly of hard foam and fake hair. The masked split in two when opened to allow the extra to put it on and was held in place by magnets inserted into the foam once closed. In the new Star Wars canon, the character was first named in the 2016 reference book Star Wars, Objets du mythe, which was written by Patrice Girod and Arnaud Grunberg.

In the Star Wars Legends continuity, the name originated on a card in the 1995 Premiere Limited set for Star Wars Customizable Card Game. published by Decipher, Inc. According to a Star Wars CCG fan site, Yalnal's name, as well as that of the Imperial Commander Nevar, were anagrams of Decipher employee Cheryl Kallenbach's pet dog, Raven.
